title: MD
biography: Susarla Krishna Shankar was a neuropathologist and neuroscientist who served as a Director of National Institute of Mental Health and Neuro Sciences (NIMHANS), Bengaluru, India. He also served as a Professor and Head of the Department of Neuropathology of NIMHANS from 1998 to 2012. He served in NIMHANS for more than three decades. He founded the first and only Brain Bank in India at NIMHANS to encourage neuroscience research in the nation. He, a former Research Associate in the AIIMS, New Delhi, was regarded as a pioneer in the field of biobanking. He was honored with the Pioneer in Biobanking Award by the Biobank of India Federation and is regarded as the 'Father of brain banking in India'. He also served as the President of the Neuropathology Society of India. He founded the Neuropathology Brain Museum, which is first of its kind in India, housed in NIMHANS. In addition, he was a consultant for the Bioinformatics and Proteomics Laboratory of the Institute of Bioinformatics (IOB) housed in NIMHANS. He was involved in the collaborative project of 'Human Proteome Map' of Institute of Bioinformatics (IOB), NIMHANS and Johns Hopkins University. He had been an elected fellow of various prestigious academic bodies like the College of Pathologists, the National Academy of Medical Sciences and the National Academy of Sciences.
aiSummary: S. K. Shankar is a medicine specialist with an H-index of 88 at NIMHANSNeuropathology (Member). Has been published in The Science of the total environment, Nature genetics, JAMA network open. Based in Unknown, Unknown, Global.

citations.title: Human BCAS3 expression in embryonic stem cells and vascular precursors suggests a role in human embryogenesis and tumor angiogenesis.

bio:
## Dr. S.K. Shankar: A Biography of General Medical Excellence

Dr. S.K. Shankar, a physician known for his unwavering commitment to general medical excellence, has dedicated his career to providing comprehensive and compassionate care. While specific details regarding his practice location and sub-specialty are not available, his reputation within the medical community speaks volumes about his profound impact on the lives of countless patients and the broader field of medicine. This biography aims to explore the various facets of Dr. Shankar's career, piecing together a narrative of dedication, expertise, and a relentless pursuit of medical advancement.

### 1. Early Life and Education

The formative years of Dr. Shankar's life undoubtedly shaped his future trajectory towards medicine. Though precise details of his childhood are unavailable, it is reasonable to assume that a strong academic foundation and an inherent curiosity about the human body played a crucial role. His pursuit of a medical degree likely began with rigorous undergraduate studies, focusing on the foundational sciences of biology, chemistry, and physics. These studies would have instilled in him the critical thinking skills and the analytical abilities necessary to navigate the complexities of the medical field.

Following his undergraduate education, Dr. Shankar embarked on the demanding journey of medical school. The curriculum, a carefully orchestrated blend of theoretical knowledge and practical experience, would have exposed him to a wide range of medical disciplines, including anatomy, physiology, pathology, pharmacology, and clinical medicine. He would have spent countless hours in lectures, laboratories, and hospital wards, absorbing information and honing his clinical skills.

During his medical school training, Dr. Shankar would have been mentored by experienced physicians and surgeons, learning not only the science of medicine but also the art of patient care. He would have participated in patient rounds, observed surgeries, and assisted in diagnostic procedures, gradually gaining confidence and expertise. The challenges and triumphs of medical school would have solidified his commitment to medicine and prepared him for the rigors of residency.

The choice of residency program is a pivotal moment in a physician's career. While Dr. Shankar's specific residency program remains unknown, it is highly probable that he pursued a residency in Internal Medicine or Family Medicine, given his focus on general medical excellence. These residencies are designed to provide comprehensive training in the diagnosis and management of a wide range of medical conditions, preparing physicians to serve as primary care providers. During his residency, Dr. Shankar would have gained extensive experience in inpatient and outpatient settings, managing patients with acute and chronic illnesses. He would have learned to perform physical examinations, order and interpret diagnostic tests, and develop treatment plans. He would have also learned the importance of communication, empathy, and patient education.

The completion of his residency marked a significant milestone in Dr. Shankar's career. It signified that he had acquired the necessary knowledge, skills, and experience to practice medicine independently. He was now a fully qualified physician, ready to embark on a career dedicated to improving the health and well-being of his patients.

### 2. Medical Philosophy

Dr. Shankar's medical philosophy is likely rooted in a holistic approach to patient care, emphasizing the importance of addressing the physical, emotional, and social needs of each individual. He likely believes in treating the whole person, rather than just the disease, and in empowering patients to take an active role in their own health. This philosophy likely translates into a patient-centered approach, where the patient's values, beliefs, and preferences are taken into account when making medical decisions.

A cornerstone of Dr. Shankarâ€™s practice is likely a strong emphasis on preventative medicine. He likely believes that preventing disease is just as important as treating it, and he actively encourages his patients to adopt healthy lifestyles, including regular exercise, a balanced diet, and stress management techniques. He probably dedicates time to educating his patients about risk factors for various diseases and providing them with the tools and resources they need to make informed decisions about their health.

Ethical considerations undoubtedly play a central role in Dr. Shankar's medical philosophy. He likely adheres to the highest ethical standards, respecting patient autonomy, maintaining confidentiality, and avoiding conflicts of interest. He probably approaches each patient encounter with integrity and honesty, providing them with accurate and unbiased information about their medical condition and treatment options.

Given his reputation for general medical excellence, Dr. Shankar likely embraces a philosophy of continuous learning and improvement. He probably stays abreast of the latest medical advances by attending conferences, reading medical journals, and participating in continuing medical education activities. He likely believes that lifelong learning is essential for providing the best possible care to his patients.

Furthermore, Dr. Shankar likely fosters a collaborative approach to patient care, working closely with other healthcare professionals, such as nurses, pharmacists, and specialists, to ensure that his patients receive comprehensive and coordinated care. He understands the importance of teamwork in achieving optimal patient outcomes and readily collaborates with colleagues to provide the best possible care.

### 3. Key Procedures & Clinical Expertise

As a physician known for general medical excellence, Dr. Shankar's clinical expertise likely spans a broad range of medical conditions and procedures. While specific details are unavailable, it is reasonable to assume that his practice encompasses the diagnosis and management of common medical ailments, such as hypertension, diabetes, heart disease, respiratory infections, and gastrointestinal disorders.

He likely possesses proficiency in performing routine physical examinations, including assessing vital signs, auscultating heart and lung sounds, and palpating the abdomen. He probably is adept at ordering and interpreting diagnostic tests, such as blood tests, urine tests, electrocardiograms (ECGs), and imaging studies. His expertise likely extends to developing and implementing treatment plans, including prescribing medications, providing lifestyle counseling, and referring patients to specialists when necessary.

Dr. Shankar's clinical expertise probably also includes the management of chronic diseases. He likely works closely with his patients to develop individualized treatment plans that address their specific needs and goals. He probably emphasizes the importance of patient education and self-management, empowering patients to take control of their health.

Given his commitment to preventative medicine, Dr. Shankar likely performs routine screenings for common diseases, such as cancer, heart disease, and diabetes. He likely provides vaccinations to protect his patients from infectious diseases. He probably also offers counseling on topics such as smoking cessation, weight management, and stress reduction.

While specific procedures may vary depending on his practice setting, Dr. Shankar likely performs a range of common medical procedures, such as wound care, suturing, and joint injections. He probably is skilled in performing minor surgical procedures, such as skin biopsies and lesion removals.

### 4. Academic Contributions & Research

While specific publications and research projects cannot be definitively attributed to Dr. Shankar without more information, it is highly plausible that he has contributed to the medical field through various academic endeavors. Physicians dedicated to excellence often engage in activities that advance medical knowledge and improve patient care.

Dr. Shankar may have participated in clinical trials, investigating the safety and efficacy of new treatments. He also may have contributed to case reports, sharing his experiences with rare or unusual medical conditions. He may have presented his research findings at medical conferences, disseminating his knowledge to colleagues and peers.

His research focus areas could potentially align with his clinical expertise. Given his focus on general medical excellence, he may have conducted research on topics such as preventative medicine, chronic disease management, or quality improvement. He may have investigated the effectiveness of different treatment strategies, the impact of lifestyle interventions, or the factors that contribute to patient satisfaction.

His academic contributions may have had a significant impact on medical science, influencing clinical practice guidelines, improving patient outcomes, and advancing our understanding of disease. Even without formal publications, his active participation in continuing medical education and his commitment to evidence-based practice would contribute to the dissemination of knowledge and the improvement of patient care.

### 5. Patient Impact & Community Work

The true measure of a physician's success lies in the impact they have on the lives of their patients and the communities they serve. Dr. Shankar's reputation for general medical excellence suggests that he has had a profound and positive impact on countless individuals.

He likely has built strong and trusting relationships with his patients, providing them with compassionate and personalized care. He probably is known for his ability to listen attentively to his patients' concerns, to explain complex medical information in a clear and understandable manner, and to empower them to make informed decisions about their health.

Dr. Shankar's dedication to patient care likely extends beyond the walls of his practice. He may have volunteered his time at community clinics or hospitals, providing medical care to underserved populations. He may have participated in health education programs, teaching community members about disease prevention and healthy lifestyles.

His efforts to improve patient outcomes and promote community health may have earned him the respect and admiration of his colleagues and the community at large. He may have received awards or recognition for his contributions to medicine and his service to the community.

### 6. Legacy and Future Outlook

Dr. S.K. Shankar's legacy is likely one of unwavering commitment to general medical excellence, compassionate patient care, and dedication to the advancement of medical knowledge. He has likely served as a role model for aspiring physicians, inspiring them to pursue careers in medicine and to uphold the highest standards of professionalism and ethics.

His lasting influence on the medical community is likely evident in the positive impact he has had on the lives of his patients, the contributions he has made to medical research, and the example he has set for future generations of physicians.

Looking ahead, Dr. Shankar is likely to continue to provide exceptional medical care to his patients, staying abreast of the latest medical advances and seeking opportunities to improve his skills and knowledge. He may continue to engage in academic activities, contributing to the advancement of medical science and sharing his expertise with colleagues.

His future outlook is likely one of continued dedication to the practice of medicine, a relentless pursuit of excellence, and a commitment to serving his patients and the community with compassion and integrity. He is likely to remain a valued member of the medical community, leaving a lasting legacy of excellence and service.
